intro: Bobartia longicyma subsp. microflora, commonly known as the small-flowered bobartia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, aromatic foliage. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are narrow and often have a subtle, spicy scent when crushed. This subspecies is distinguished by its smaller flowers and more compact growth habit compared to other members of the species.
